intro: Cyclopogon secundum, commonly known as the narrow-leaf cyclopogon, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean. It belongs to the family Poaceae, commonly known as the grass family. The plant is characterized by its slender, grass-like appearance with narrow, linear leaves. It produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny, white or pale blue flowers. Cyclopogon secundum is often found in wetland or marshy habitats, where it thrives in moist, nutrient-rich soils.
